title: 115_hr4562
content: The "Community Bank Access to Capital Act of 2017" may be cited as the Act. It includes an exemption for community banks from Basel III regulations. The "Community Bank Access to Capital Act of 2017" defines a community bank as an insured depository institution or a depository institution holding company with assets not exceeding $50,000,000,000. It also clarifies the terms "insured depository institution" and "depository institution holding company." Regulations must be established within 90 days of the Act's enactment by the Comptroller of the Currency, the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, and the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The Federal Reserve, FDIC, and OCC will exempt community banks from Basel III regulations. They will adjust capital requirements as needed based on the new regulations. The Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 is amended to exempt insured depository institutions or depository institution holding companies with assets not exceeding $1,000,000,000 from internal control attestation requirements. Additionally, Regulation D changes are implemented. Regulation D changes will increase the limit on the number of purchasers from 35 to 70 within 90 days of the Act's enactment. Additionally, adjustments to the Small Bank Holding Company Policy Statement on financial and managerial factors are required. The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System will revise the Small Bank Holding Company and Savings and Loan Holding Company Policy Statement to increase the asset threshold from $1 billion to $3 billion for bank holding companies or savings and loan holding companies within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Small Bank Holding Company and Savings and Loan Holding Company Policy Statement will be revised to raise the asset threshold from $1 billion to $3 billion for qualifying companies. Exclusions may apply based on supervisory purposes. The Financial Stability Act of 2010 is amended to include bank holding companies and savings and loan holding companies subject to the Small Bank Holding Company and Savings and Loan Holding Company Policy Statement.
